alert.note: Alert for Western Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 12:29PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Essex County through 130 PM EDT... At 1228 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of thunderstorms with heavy rainfall along a line extending from Mount Marcy to near Golden Beach Campground. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. Heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Ponding in poor drainage areas on roads possible. Locations impacted include... Elizabethtown, Minerva, Newcomb, Mount Marcy, Keene Valley, North Hudson, Olmstedville, Underwood, Schroon Falls, St. Huberts, Tahawus, New Russia, and Vanderwhacker Mountain. This includes Interstate 87 between mile markers 91 and 94, between mile markers 96 and 108, and between mile markers 111 and 114. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
